paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 21 of 2004 s. 14)

subsection.name: 7I
subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes section 12E(1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years. (Added 21 of 2004 s. 14)

subsection.name: 7J
subsection.content: Any person who intentionally and without reasonable excuse obstructs any person in the exercise of his powers under a warrant issued under section 12G(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 21 of 2004 s. 14)

Summary proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, being an offence alleged to have been committed outside the HKSAR, may be commenced at any time not later than 12 months from the date on which the person charged first enters the HKSAR after committing the offence.
No proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance shall be instituted in the HKSAR except by or with the consent of the Secretary for Justice.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Supplementary provisions applicable to licences mentioned in section 6(1), 8 or 8A

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of conditions and exceptions which may be specified in a licence mentioned in section 6(1) or 8A— (Amended 14 of 2018 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: such conditions may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: relate to specifying the manner in which the property to which the licence relates shall be held from time to time;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: relate to the appointment of a receiver to take possession of the property and to deal with it in a manner which preserves the value of the property or any other property into which it is converted; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: such exceptions may relate but are not limited to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasonable living expenses;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the reasonable legal expenses; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the payments liable to be made under the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57),

paragraph.continued: of any person by, for or on behalf of whom the property is held. (Amended 20 of 2012 s. 7)

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of conditions and exceptions which may be specified in a licence mentioned in section 8, such exceptions may relate to the reasonable living expenses, reasonable legal expenses and the payments liable to be made under the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57) of the person second-mentioned in that section to which the licence relates.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Delegations

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may, to such extent and subject to such restrictions and conditions as the Chief Executive may think proper, delegate or authorize the delegation of any of the Chief Executive’s functions under this Ordinance to any public officer, or class or description of public officers, approved by the Chief Executive, and references in this Ordinance to the Chief Executive shall be construed accordingly.

The Secretary may, to such extent and subject to such restrictions and conditions as the Secretary may think proper, delegate or authorize the delegation of any of the Secretary’s functions under this Ordinance to any public officer, or class or description of public officers, approved by the Secretary, and references in this Ordinance to the Secretary shall be construed accordingly.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Applications to Court of First Instance

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an application under section 5(1) has been made ex parte and in consequence thereof an order under section 5(2) has been published in the Gazette, then—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any person specified in the order, or any person acting for or on behalf of the person so specified, may at any time make an application to the Court for the order to be revoked to the extent that it relates to the person so specified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any person by, for or on behalf of whom any property specified in the order is held, or any other person in respect of whom the Court is satisfied that the person is affected by the order, may at any time make an application to the Court for the order to be revoked to the extent that it relates to the property so specified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice has been given under section 6(1), then any person by, for or on behalf of whom any property specified in the notice is held, or any other person in respect of whom the Court is satisfied that the person is affected by the notice, may at any time make an application to the Court for the notice to be revoked to the extent that it relates to the property so specified.

subsection.leadIn: A person who makes an application under subsection (1) shall give a copy of the application (and an affidavit, if any, and other relevant documents, if any, in support)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Secretary for Justice and, in the case of an application under subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (b), to any other person by, for or on behalf of whom the property concerned is held; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application or such shorter period as the Court may permit pursuant to rules of court.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an application under subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii), the presumption mentioned in section 5(4) shall not be applicable, whether for the purposes of the proceedings or otherwise, immediately upon the initiation of the proceedings and until the conclusion of the proceedings (including the conclusion of any appeal arising out of the proceedings); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Court shall grant the application unless— (Amended 21 of 2004 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where subsection (1)(a)(i) is applicable, the Court is satisfied that the person specified in the order concerned under section 5(2) is a terrorist or terrorist associate, as the case may be;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where subsection (1)(a)(ii) is applicable, the Court is satisfied that the property specified in the order concerned under section 5(2) is terrorist property;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where subsection (1)(b) is applicable, the Court is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the property specified in the notice concerned under section 6(1) is terrorist property.

subsection.leadIn: An application for—

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the revocation or variation of a direction mentioned in section 6(10) may be made by any person affected by the notice under section 6(1) in which the direction appears; (Added 21 of 2004 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of a licence mentioned in section 6(1), 8 or 8A may be made by any person affected by the operation of that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the variation of a licence mentioned in section 6(1), 8 or 8A may be made by any person affected by the licence. (Amended 14 of 2018 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: A person who makes an application under subsection (4) shall give a copy of the application (and affidavit, if any, and other relevant documents, if any, in support)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to the Secretary for Justice and to any other person affected by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the notice under section 6(1) concerned;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the operation concerned of section 6(1), 8 or 8A; or (Amended 14 of 2018 s. 10)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the licence concerned,

paragraph.continued: as the case may be; and (Replaced 21 of 2004 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application or such shorter period as the Court may permit pursuant to rules of court.

subsection.content: The Court shall not grant an application under subsection (4) unless it is satisfied that it is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case to do so.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings relating to an application under subsection (4) (including proceedings relating to any appeal) are no longer pending; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the direction to which the application relates—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is, or is still, required to be revoked; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is, or is still, required to be varied; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the licence to which the application relates—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is, or is still, required to be granted; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is, or is still, required to be varied,

paragraph.continued: as the case may be, (Replaced 21 of 2004 s. 16)

subsection.continued: then the Secretary shall, as soon as is practicable, cause the direction to be revoked or varied, or the licence to be granted or varied, as the case may be, accordingly.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Compensation

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has ceased to be specified as a terrorist or terrorist associate under section 5(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: property has ceased to be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: specified as terrorist property under section 5(2); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: specified in a notice under section 6(1),

subsection.continued: then the Court may, on application by— (Amended 21 of 2004 s. 21)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a), the person who was so specified, or any person acting for or on behalf of the person who was so specified;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where paragraph (b) is applicable, any person by, for or on behalf of whom the property that was so specified is held,

subsection.continued: order compensation to be paid by the Government to the applicant if, having regard to all the circumstances, it considers it appropriate to make such an order.

subsection.leadIn: The Court shall not order compensation to be paid under subsection (1) unless it is satisfied— (Amended 21 of 2004 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where subsection (1)(a) is applicable, that at no time when the person concerned was specified as a terrorist or terrorist associate under section 5(2) was the person either a terrorist or terrorist associate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where subsection (1)(b) is applicable, that at no time when the property was specified as terrorist property under section 5(2), or was specified in a notice under section 6(1), as the case may be, was the property terrorist property;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that there has been some default on the part of any person concerned in obtaining the relevant specification under section 5(2) or 6(1); and (Amended 21 of 2004 s. 17)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant has, in consequence of the relevant specification and the default mentioned in paragraph (c), suffered loss.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (1), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any property is seized property within the meaning of section 12F; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subsequently, none of the following events occurs—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the property is specified in a notice under section 6(1);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the property is forfeited under section 13;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: proceedings are instituted (whether in the HKSAR or elsewhere)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: against any person in relation to an offence with which the property is connected; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: which may result in the forfeiture or other confiscation of the property,

subsection.continued: the Court may, on an application made by any person by, for or on behalf of whom the property was held, order compensation to be paid by the Government to the applicant if, having regard to all the circumstances, it considers it appropriate to make such an order. (Added 21 of 2004 s. 17)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: The Court shall not order compensation to be paid under subsection (2A) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there has been some default on the part of any person concerned with the seizure or detention of the property concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has, in consequence of such seizure or detention and the default mentioned in paragraph (a), suffered loss in relation to the property. (Added 21 of 2004 s. 17)

subsection.content: The amount of compensation to be paid under this section shall be such as the Court thinks just in all the circumstances of the case. (Amended 21 of 2004 s. 21)

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Saving of common law remedies

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), nothing in section 18 affects any remedy available to a person at common law.

Where a court orders any compensation under section 18 or damages at common law in respect of any default, the court shall take into account, in reduction of the amount of compensation or damages, any amount awarded as damages or ordered as compensation (as the case may be) in respect of that default.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Procedure

subsection.leadIn: Provision may be made by rules of court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: with respect to applications under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 5;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 13;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: section 17; or (Replaced 21 of 2004 s. 20)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: section 18; (Replaced 21 of 2004 s. 20)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), with respect to the circumstances in which applications mentioned in that paragraph shall be made ex parte;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), with respect to expediting, on grounds specified in the rules, the hearing of applications mentioned in that paragraph;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: with respect to the division, conversion or disposal of property for the purposes of satisfying an order under section 13(1) to which the property is subject where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 13(2) is applicable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the property is not readily divisible for those purposes;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), prescribing interests for the purposes of the definition of prescribed interest;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: generally with respect to the procedure under this Ordinance before any court.

subsection.leadIn: Rules of court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall provide for applications by any person on whom a requirement is imposed under an order under section 12A or 12B for the revocation or variation of such order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may provide for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: proceedings relating to section 12A, 12B or 12C;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: conditions that must be satisfied before a person (including the Secretary for Justice) referred to in section 12A(11) may obtain a copy of an order under section 12A. (Replaced 21 of 2004 s. 20)

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) are without prejudice to the generality of any existing power to make rules. (Replaced 21 of 2004 s. 20)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Proceedings inter partes shall be held in open court unless otherwise ordered by the court

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), proceedings inter partes in respect of applications mentioned in section 20(1)(a) shall be held in open court unless the court otherwise orders, upon application made by any party to the proceedings, that all or part of the proceedings shall be held in chambers or in camera.

subsection.leadIn: The court shall not make an order that proceedings mentioned in subsection (1) shall be held in chambers or in camera unless the court is satisfied that the order is reasonably necessary in the interests of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the security, defence or external relations of the HKSAR; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the administration of justice.

subsection.def: In this section, court (法庭) includes a magistrate.
